column1: #This is the DAVILA customization file for Derrida's Margins
#make sure you remove any quotation marks or unnecessary spaces from the csv file, they will confuse the parser!
#These lines set the metadata for your diagram, the information will display in the top left corner, in bold

column2: Katie Chenoweth, Rebecca Koeser, Jean Bauer, Ben Hicks

column1: #This next group of lines allows you to color code your modules and indicate which entity is the central node of that module
#The central node allows you to choose whether to display all the entities in the module, or just the central entity and module name to save space
#If you don't want to indicate a central module, make sure there is '
column2: ' immediately after the hex color, otherwise the parser will throw an

column1: #Probably best to limit your diagram to 5 or 6 modules, otherwise it can get confusing
#This next line lets you license your diagram under the copyright(or copyleft) of your choice
#The license will display in the bottom left corner

column2: This work is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-Share-Alike 3.0 License

column1: #The following lines assign a module and an annotation to each entity in the database
#ENTITY NAME(*exactly* as it appears in your schema)

column3: A particular instance or copy of an item in Derrida's library; could be a book section associated with another instance
Derrida works that cite this edition or instance
Catalog information to describe where the item is held
Language of a particular instance, if different from a work (i.e. translation language)
Page images to be suppressed, to comply with copyright owner take-down request
Journals, for association with items published as journal articles
Language that a book is written in or a language included in a book
Institution that owns the physical copy of the item
Interactions or connections between books and people other than annotation.
Type of non-annotation relationship assocating a person with a book.
Generic work information that applies to all instances of an item in Derrida's library
A work authored by Derrida (i.e. Of Grammatology)
A reference in a work by Derrida
Type of reference, i.e. citation, quotation, footnotes, epigraph, etc.
Sections or chapters of a Derrida work; used to view references by section of the work
